subject: Re: [junit] a test pattern ?
msgSnippet: ... My apologies. It s not much of a story, I m afraid. I know a Ross Rainwater and my fingers did the rest. It serves me right for typing when I ought to
messageBody:
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger wrote:
>Adam Wildavsky wrote:
> > There are a number of books that contain testing patterns. Ross
> > Rainsberger's "JUnit Recipes" was just recommended.
>
>"Ross Rainsberger"?! Wow. Where the hell did you get /that/ first name?
>:) (I'm sure there's a neat story behind that.)
>
>It's J. B. Rainsberger, thanks.

My apologies. It's not much of a story, I'm afraid. I know a "Ross
Rainwater" and my fingers did the rest. It serves me right for typing
when I ought to have been copying and pasting.

Where was SmptUnit when I needed it?

--
Adam Wildavsky adam@... http://www.tameware.com
